Settings.description: A block for managing all bandwidth and sweep time settings.

Presets.description: A block for managing all bandwidth-related presets.

Fast.label: Fast
Fast.description: Like a race car: fast sweep, low detail. Best for catching fleeting signals.

Brisk.label: Brisk
Brisk.description: A jog through the spectrum; quick enough to see the sights without missing much.

Deliberate.label: Deliberate
Deliberate.description: The perfect balance of speed and fidelity. Not too fast, not too slow.

Steady.label: Steady
Steady.description: A calm stroll, giving you time to appreciate the finer signal details.

Leisurely.label: Leisurely
Leisurely.description: A slow saunter through the noise floor, where every waveform is a work of art.

Unhurried.label: Unhurried
Unhurried.description: For the patient scientist. You'll see things nobody else can, but it'll take a while.

Slothlike.label: Slothlike
Slothlike.description: So slow you can practically see the electrons move. The highest fidelity, but you'll miss any quick events.

Slothlike_1.label: Slothlike
Slothlike_1.description: So slow you can practically see the electrons move. The highest fidelity, but you'll miss any quick events.

Ultra_Fast.label: Ultra Fast
Ultra_Fast.description: A lightning-fast sweep. Filters are wide open, letting everything through.

Very_Fast.label: Very Fast
Very_Fast.description: A quick pass through the spectrum, ideal for fast-changing signals.

Fast.label: Fast
Fast.description: A balanced speed for general purpose monitoring and signal capture.

Normal.label: Normal
Normal.description: The standard filter setting for most common analysis tasks. Not too much, not too little.

Slow.label: Slow
Slow.description: A gentle filter, giving you more time to appreciate the finer details of a waveform.

Very_Slow.label: Very Slow
Very_Slow.description: For the meticulous scientist. You'll filter out fast noise and jitter, but at the cost of speed.

Ultra_Slow.label: Ultra Slow
Ultra_Slow.description: A meditative pace. So slow you can practically see the electrons move, offering maximum stability and noise reduction.

Glacial.label: Glacial
Glacial.description: A slow crawl. Good for very detailed analysis of continuous signals and filtering out transient noise.

Glacial_1.label: Glacial
Glacial_1.description: A slow crawl. Good for very detailed analysis of continuous signals and filtering out transient noise.

Sub-Glacial.label: Sub-Glacial
Sub-Glacial.description: The scanner cries, but it's worth it. Filters out almost all random noise, giving you a crystal-clear, steady line.

Sub-Glacial_1.label: Sub-Glacial
Sub-Glacial_1.description: The scanner cries, but it's worth it. Filters out almost all random noise, giving you a crystal-clear, steady line.

Crazy_Slow.label: Crazy Slow
Crazy_Slow.description: Time seems to stop. For the most patient scientists and signals with incredible stability. The ultimate low-pass filter.

Crazy_Slow_1.label: Crazy Slow
Crazy_Slow_1.description: Time seems to stop. For the most patient scientists and signals with incredible stability. The ultimate low-pass filter.

ON.label: CONTINUOUS ON
ON.description: Turns on continuous sweep mode. The scanner never rests!

OFF.label: CONTINUOUS OFF
OFF.description: Turns off continuous sweep mode. The scanner will perform a single sweep and then rest.

0.label: Off
0.description: Just a raw, single sweep. Great for seeing fast changes and fleeting events, but the noise floor is high and the trace is very jittery.

5.label: Light Filter
5.description: A very mild smoothing of the signal, removing some of the jitter. It's like putting a slight damper on the noise, making the trace a little easier to read.

10.label: Getting Clear
10.description: The trace becomes noticeably less fuzzy. The random spikes of the noise floor start to settle down, revealing more consistent signals.

25.label: The Sweet Spot
25.description: A good balance of noise reduction and display speed. The noise floor is clean, and low-level, stable signals are clearly visible.

50.label: Steady Hands
50.description: The noise floor is now very stable and appears as a thin line. You're only seeing the most consistent signals and cutting out most of the random interference.

75.label: Deep Dive
75.description: This setting is for serious analysis. It's a highly stable trace that filters out a large portion of the ambient RF noise, allowing for precise measurements of continuous signals.

100.label: Scientific Grade
100.description: For when only the cleanest signal will do. This high level of averaging provides a virtually noise-free display, perfect for scientific or very low-level signal detection.

200.label: Crystal Clear
200.description: A deep and thorough look at the spectrum. All but the most stable signals are averaged out, offering a truly pristine view of the fundamental RF environment.

500.label: The Observer
500.description: An incredibly slow and deliberate pace. This is for long-term monitoring, allowing you to see the overall shape of the spectrum with almost all noise removed.

1000.label: Meditative Mode
1000.description: For the patient and the meticulous. This is the ultimate level of noise reduction, yielding an exceptionally smooth and stable trace for the most demanding analysis.
